questions.question: The water vapor and pollutants tend to get trapped in the lowermost layers of the atmospherein winters. What is the reason behind this occurrence?
Which of the following is not an indicator of air pollution?
questions.explanation: The heavy metal pollution index (HPI) is not an indicator of air pollution. It is a rating methodand an effective tool to assess the water quality with respect to heavy metals.Indicators of air pollution:•Sulfur dioxide - best indicator• Smoke or soiling index•Grit and dust measurement• The co-efficient of haze• Air pollution index•Suspended particle matter (SPM)

questions.question: Which agency monitors air quality in India?
questions.explanation: Central Pollution Control Board is the main body that monitors air quality in India and setsstandards.

questions.question: Greenhouse gases include all of the following except:
questions.explanation: Carbon monoxide is not a greenhouse gas. Greenhouse gases include: • Water vapor • Carbon dioxide • Methane • Tropospheric ozone • Nitrous oxide • Chlorofluorocarbons (non-natural)

questions.question: Which of the following protocols set the standard to reduce the emission of greenhouse gasesinternationally?
questions.explanation: The Kyoto Protocol was an internal agreement to set internationally binding emission reductiontargets.It is linked to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change. The partiescommitted to reduce GHGs by 18% in the period between 2013-2020.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about global warming?

options.A: Carbon dioxide is the major greenhouse gas
options.C: CFCs decrease ozone levels in the stratosphere
options.D: The Kyoto Protocol called for a 10% reduction in greenhouse emissions

questions.explanation: Carbon dioxide is the major greenhouse gas. Tropospheric ozone and chlorofluorocarbons are also important greenhouse gases. Water vapor is the most abundant greenhouse gas, but the water vapor produced directly by human activity contributes very little to the amount of water vapor in the atmosphere. Hence, its emissions have not been estimated. Greenhouse gases lead to global warming, which is the major cause of climate change. Climate change accelerates species extinction on earth.

questions.question: Which of the following is incorrect regarding indoor air pollutants?

options.A: Carbon monoxide is produced by fuel combustion
options.C: Radon is an indoor air pollutant
options.D: Mercury vapor is a source of indoor air pollution

questions.explanation: Mercury is not a source of indoor air pollution.Indoor air pollutants commonly arise from coal or fuel combustion. They include:• Carbon monoxide•Polyaromatic hydrocarbons• Nitrogen• Sulfur oxides• Pesticides• Asbestos575• Lead• Radon

questions.question: Which of the following is unlikely to be seen in individuals affected by indoor air pollution?
questions.explanation: Indoor air pollution has not been linked with neurodevelopmental disorders. It can result in ahigher incidence of the following:•Pregnancy complications•Chronic lung disease• Childhood pneumonia

questions.question: The best indicators for routine monitoring of air pollution are:

options.A: Sulfur dioxide, smoke, and suspended particles
options.B: Sulfur dioxide, lead, and particulate matter

questions.explanation: The best indicators for routine monitoring of air pollution are sulfur dioxide, smoke, andsuspended particles.

questions.question: What are the instruments used to measure atmospheric pressure called?
questions.explanation: Atmospheric pressure or barometric pressure is measured using barometers.The most commonly known barometers are Fortin's barometer, Kew pattern station barometer,and the barograph. The Indian Meteorological Department uses the Kew pattern stationbarometer.The pressure at Earth's surface, close to sea level averages around 760 mmHg, and man isadapted to live around this.

questions.question: What sweat excretion rate in acclimatized, healthy young men is indicative of intolerable airtemperature?
questions.explanation: A sweat excretion rate of > 4.5 L/4 hours in acclimatized, healthy young men is indicative ofintolerable air temperature. This is known as McArdle's maximum allowable sweat rate.This is the maximum allowable sweat rate that is compatible with the normal physiologicalreaction of acclimatized, healthy young men who are exposed to heat. The predicted four-hoursweat rate (P4SR) is obtained from readings of air and mean radiant temperature and air velocityunder different work intensities. Based on this value, the zone of comfort can be determined.Zone of comfortPredictedP4SRComfort zone1-3 litresJust tolerableIntolerable3-4.5 litres4.5 + litres

questions.question: Which of the following is not an index of heat stress?
questions.explanation: Air velocity index is not an index of heat stress.Heat stress is the load of heat that must be dissipated from the body if it is to remain in thermalequilibrium. Factors that affect heat stress are metabolic rate, air temperature, humidity, airmovement, and radiant temperature.Indices for heat stress are:• Predicted four-hour sweat rate• Equatorial comfort index• Heat stress index.

questions.question: Which of the following is unlikely to be seen in individuals suffering from heat stress?
questions.explanation: Numbness is an effect of cold stress, not heat stress.Effects of heat stress include:• Heatstroke.• Heat hyperpyrexia• Heat exhaustion• Heat cramps• Heat syncope

questions.question: Which of the following is incorrect about cold stress?

options.B: Dry-cold conditions occur at temperatures above freezing
options.C: Cold stress can cause desire to sleep
options.D: Frostbite is common at high altitudes

questions.explanation: Dry-cold conditions occur at temperatures below freezing and are common at high altitudes. Itresults in complications like frostbite.Wet-cold conditions occur at temperatures above freezing. It results in complications like trenchfoot. Cold stress also causes hypothermia which can induce numbness, loss of sensations,muscular weakness, desire to sleep, coma, and death.
